column1: When she goes out to walk
column2: she finds her way as well as she can by groping about with her big umbrella. Very often she loses her way
column3: and goes in the wrong direction; and sometimes she gets bewildered: but I have never known her to be really lost or hurt. There is always somebody to set her right; and it is pleasant to see how kind every one is to her.Many a time I have seen some gentleman
column4: while hurrying to catch his train
column5: stop to help her over the crossing; or some handsomely-dressed lady take her by the arm
column7: when she has gone astray.Best of all it is
column9: to see the children so kind to her. She comes to our square every Saturday; and
column10: as she is very apt to go to the wrong gate
column11: the little girls—bless their dear hearts!—seem to consider it their duty to guide her
column12: and to help her over the slippery places.
